text:
Tomcat chrashes at Cisco LMS toll

after it tomcat doesn´t start up anymore


A DESCRIPTION OF THE PROBLEM :
#
# An unexpected error has been detected by HotSpot Virtual Machine:
#
#  EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x7c9111de, pid=3512, tid=1324
#
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.5.0_03-b07 mixed mode)
# Problematic frame:
# C  [ntdll.dll+0x111de]
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as hs_err_pid3512.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
#
creator: carli.marcio@gmail.com

text:
1) This is a JVM or Windows error, not a Tomcat problem.

2) The JVM version you're using is no longer supported by Oracle.

(The Tomcat version you reported isn't exactly up-to-date either.)

Please read the notes at the end of what you posted.
creator: chuck.caldarale@unisys.com
knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text:
1. If you seek help for troubleshooting you may ask on the users mailing list, though as JVM and Tomcat you are using are very old it is unlikely that anyone will be able to reproduce your problem.
For a JVM issue it is likely that it is already fixed in a subsequent Java version. There is no Tomcat bug in your report.

2. The details of your failure are in the "hs_err_pid3512.log" file. You are
not providing it.

3. You have to define what "does not start up" mean and how you are launching
Tomcat, and provide the logs, if there are any.

creator: carli.marcio@gmail.com
text:
the bug happens in different versions of JVM, i´ve also installed a new one and nothing changed.

the problem is after it happens once, Tomcat doesn´t start anymore even if I restart the machine.

http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6358748

creator: chuck.caldarale@unisys.com
text: To emphasize Konstantin's first point, bugzilla is not a support forum.  Post your queries on the user's mailing list.
